description: blue and white plate at right and footed bowl at left with peaches, apples, pears, lemons and green grapes; football-shaped dish on a matching saucer at center--blue and white with touches of green and red; green and white jug behind dish and saucer; large blue and white base to left of green and white jug with pink, white and yellow flowers; apples, pears and lemons on white and red cloths on tabletop
image_copyright: © Estate Georges d%27Espagnat %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
signed: URC, in green: g v [?] E
text: Georges d’Espagnat was a self-trained artist who worked in a variety of styles from Impressionism to Fauvism. He was a protégé of Pierre Auguste Renoir and exhibited regularly with the major artists of the period, including Pierre Bonnard and Henri Matisse. In later life he was a Professor at the Ecole Nationale Superieure des Beaux-Arts in Paris.
title: Fruits and Vase of Flowers
